required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Botanical Oil Supplementation in Diabetic and Metabolic Syndrome Subjects
clinical_study.official_title: Modulation of Biomarkers and Gene Expression by Botanical Oil Supplementation in Diabetic and Metabolic Syndrome Subjects.

brief_summary.textblock: This study will compare how well a combination of borage and echium oils will reduce inflammation compared to fish oils and placebo oil in subjects that are diabetic or have metabolic syndrome.

primary_outcome.description: Fasting insulin data at 4 and 8 weeks was averaged.
Changes in high sensitive C-reactive protein (hsCRP) were assessed.
Changes in high sensitive C-reactive protein (hsCRP) were assessed and data at 4 and 8 weeks was averaged..
Data at 4 and 8 weeks was averaged.

secondary_outcome.description: Data at 4 and 8 weeks was averaged.
Data at 4 and 8 weeks was averaged.
Data at 4 and 8 weeks was averaged.

secondary_outcome.measure: SNPs in DNA of Selected Genes
SNPs in DNA of Selected Genes

arm_group.description: borage/echium oil combination containing 0.85g/day SDA and 1.7 g/day GLA

intervention.description: borage/echium oil combination containing 0.85g/day SDA and 1.7g/day GLA
intervention.other_name: Croda borage oil, Crossential GLA TG40

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- adults, aged 21 years or more with either diabetes or metabolic syndrome. metabolic syndrome defined by NCEP/ATPIII criteria; must have 3 out of 5 of the following risk factors: 1.central obesity, men-greater than or equal to 40 inches, women-greater than or equal to 35 inches; 2.fasting blood TG greater than or equal to 150mg/dl or be taking TG lowering medications; 3. blood HDL cholesterol, men less than 40 mg/dl, women less than 50 mg/dl; 4. blood pressure greater than or equal to 130/85 or on HTN medication 5. fasting glucose greater than or equal to 100 mg/dl.
- participants on statins or glucose lowering drugs if dosages are stable for 3 months
Exclusion criteria
- children/young adults less than 21 years of age
- currently using anti-inflammatory drugs including NSAIDS, oral/IV steroids or injection antiinflammatory drugs(for RA), aspirin greater than 100mg/day
- taking leukotriene receptor antagonists ( montelukast), tylenol or nasal/inhaled steroids OK.
- currently using niacin, fibrates or fish oil
- blood pressure greater than 170/100
- HB1Ac greater than 10%
- TG greater than 500 mg/dl
- myocardial infarction/vascular surgery/stroke within the past year
- any stage II,III,IV heart failure
- prior cholecystectomy
- end stage renal disease
- BMI less than 23 or greater than 45
- pregnancy
- alcohol use greater than 14 drinks per week
- current self reported tobacco or illicit drug use
- intolerance or allergy to fish oil
- participants taking insulin on QD or BID doses, stable for 3 months

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: 80 participants signed consent, only 71 were randomized to an arm/group

event.description: blood sugar varied 1 day or more

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: The diet study was short at only 8 weeks of oil supplementation, it did not control background PUFA consumption by the subjects throught their normal diets, and the population contained subjects at various stages of T2D.
